sub_title: Consultant & Venture Builder | x-FrieslandCampina | x-Accenture | x-AIESEC | MBA-IE University
summary:
Founded 3 startups, delivered a 1-billion-euros cost reduction program, implemented 2 global cloud-based applications, led a program running across 127 countries, among other responsibilities.

Procure-to-Pay and Operations Management expert with extensive International Program and Project Management experience in Consumer Products and Retail Industries, and Social Development Sector.

I had the opportunity to work in 14 countries, with over 100 nationalities, over the past 11 years of professional experience, and lead 7 teams across different organizations.

A jack of all trades; passionate about continuous learning, driven to make a lasting impact, and resilient in the face of adversity.

projects.title: International Congress, August 2013
projects.description:
AIESEC International Congress is one of the world's biggest learning conferences.

Through a series of discussions and seminars with global business, cultural, science, political, GO and NGO leaders, 1200 young leaders from 124 countries will have a unique opportunity to exchange opinions and discuss the most relevant issues affecting today’s world.

International Congress is one of the major events that took place in Egypt in 2013, for it puts together the essence of a youth-organized conference, a professional engagement event to unite the business sector with young ideas and vice versa, and an event that enables the public to interact with AIESECers from around the world in what could be the world’s largest congregation of youth leadership.

contributors.headline: Consultant & Venture Builder | x-FrieslandCampina | x-Accenture | x-AIESEC | MBA-IE University

profile_positions.description:
‣ Eliminated backorders on all key SKUs, reduced shipping costs by 50% through reorganizing the fulfilment network and optimized stock levels across all locations to improve cash flow.
‣ Improved ERP utilization by cleansing master and operational data, improving SOPs for inventory management, POs and SOs management, and resolving integration issues with sales channels and fulfilment centres.
‣ Signed contracts to formalize agreements with manufacturing suppliers, and created the QC SOP in alignment with the suppliers to improve quality and reduce returns. Changed packaging supplier, onboarded the new supplier to improve quality, and changed packaging designs and variations to reduce 55% of packaging costs.
profile_positions.title: Head of Operations

profile_positions.description:
Personal Care: Mr. Mammoth 
Created a brand to serve consumers in need of plastic-free and completely natural personal care products. Bootstrapped, developed in a lean approach, and grown in less than a year to consistently serve hundreds of customers monthly, using a carbon-neutral supply chain, in the Netherlands and the UK.
‣ Founded a personal care startup for middle-aged men struggling to find effective vegan natural products.
‣ Built a sustainable supply chain with zero waste and carbon-neutral operations to create positive impact, delivering hundreds of products in 6 countries.
‣ Pivoted our target segment and branding to the growing female base, contributing to over 30% of total sales.

Automotive Industry: Top Autos
Developed a one-stop-shop for customers in Egypt looking to import cars from Germany. Leveraged data from major car marketplaces in Germany, built relations with key showrooms to have access and priority to their stock, and focused on value added services to deliver tens of orders to multiple clients.
‣ Developed an online portal for car import from the EU to Egypt for Egyptian consumers, to capitalize on trade agreements that came into effect.
‣ Managed everything from sourcing, inspection, import/export clearance until handover to customer.

Web3: Kore Syndicate
‣ Founded an NFT community for entrepreneurs and investors in the Middle East to learn about Web3 impact in their industries, identify investment opportunities in the space, and collaborate on new Web3 projects together.

Additional ventures include nutrition planning assistant, webshop for children’s safety products, product development for premium shaders/tents, among others.
profile_positions.title: Venture Builder/Business Designer

profile_positions.description:
‣ Developed and deployed a global Procure-to-Pay solution to bring integral cost and process optimization for Procurement, Accounts Payable and IT. The solution included 15 Informatica cloud middleware interfaces between SAP and Coupa, as well as SAP and Coupa configuration, and covered indirect, MRO and direct spend. The solution is currently being deployed to all the clients’ locations globally starting with Asia.
‣ Managed the Coupa releases (R19 to R26). Initiated the first stream to manage changes to as-is business activities and ensure minimal impact of users. Subsequently, expanded to add another stream to manage new features and opportunities to leverage and maximize the value we bring from our Source to Pay platform.
‣ Kicked off a business intelligence project to deliver automated reports to the procurement community, starting with unlocking data sources up to collecting users' feedback on report layouts and features. The solution included BW, Coupa and CSV data sources loaded to a data lake in Redshift and visualized on Microstrategy.
‣ Updated the supplier onboarding strategy to suit the new source to pay platform (Coupa) and implemented it for China deployment.
‣ Developed agile project management methodology specifically tailored to FrieslandCampina needs, primarily based on Scrum methodology.

Responsibilities:
‣ Procurement business consultant.
‣ Coupa releases' manager.
‣ Solution delivery lead for Procure to Pay in the Cloud project.
‣ Project manager for business intelligence project (part of the digital roadmap).
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant Process Transformation Office

profile_positions.description:
‣ Delivered the Zero Based Budgeting program with a team of 180 members from Accenture and the international consumer goods client. Transformed visibility over the full spend, redefined ownership over costs to enhance accountability, and identified saving opportunities of €1 billion.
‣ Conducted a procurement assessment to realise non-merchandising savings for an international fashion retailer and change their approach to market. Supported the client’s procurement team to coordinate with the business stakeholders, build the business cases, get their buy-in and approach the market. Focused on facility management, IT, professional services and marcom categories to realise 7 million € target.
‣ Transformed the Order to Cash operating model for a leading international consumer goods client, to change their service strategy and put them as a leader in customer service and satisfaction. Adapted global service model based on the regional status and a phased approach was developed to transform towards the global model.
‣ Conducted full assessment on offer to cash value chain for a global medical devices' client, and identified the best in class solutions with Accenture subject-matter experts. Identified short term improvement opportunities, and a long term transformation roadmap.
‣ Additional projects undertaken for supplier onboarding, procurement catalog revamp based on new strategy, offer to cash assessment and roadmap creation, business development, among others.

Responsibilities:
Supported clients across consumer products, medical equipment and fashion retail industries with order to cash value stream optimisation, strategic sourcing and procure-to-pay implementations, and zero based budgeting projects as a Junior and Senior management consultant.
profile_positions.title: Senior Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
‣ Led the global AIESEC network of 60,000 members as a part of a team of 24 members from 17 nationalities. Managed the international leadership development program with 26,000 participants yearly, running across 127 countries, focused on societal entrepreneurship and creating positive impact, realizing 15% growth.
‣ Contributed as the product owner to the development and rollout of a cloud-based management system to be used across all 127 countries by the 60,000 members in the AIESEC network. Sign Up to Delivery process was revamped to be more efficient, payment structure was changed to increase participation, and a new matching algorithm was developed with an external party to automate a time-consuming part of the process.
‣ Led the global culture assessment and change management, in collaboration with Barrett Values Centre. Surveyed 3790 members for the assessment and managed the change using a leader lead model. Empowered our 60,000 members in local branches to be the source of innovations and solutions, through the cultural transformation project to become a Bottom-Up organisation.
‣ Designed the concept for a recommendation system, and oversaw part of its development, to support our customers in finding the most relevant opportunities for their profiles.
‣ Developed the "AIESEC Experience 2020" framework to be used for engaging our network to evolve our current value propositions and programs for our following 5-years midterm ambition.

Responsibilities:
Managing innovation for the leadership development program with 26,000 participants yearly running across 127 countries and territories, through regional and national partnerships with organisations such as Amana Key and UNESCO and multinational companies such PwC and Microsoft mobilising societal entrepreneurship and adapting the unique internships to the changing society and integrating diversity.
profile_positions.title: Global VP Program Innovation

profile_positions.description:
‣ Led a cross-functional team of 17 directors and managers to achieve 40% growth through scaling operations from 6 local offices to 18 local offices and setting up an in-house marketing department.
‣ Managed 18 teams of 4-10 members leading the local offices, and an organization of 1600 members. One of our 18 offices became the largest operating office and achieved the highest performance in the network.
‣ Delivered the largest international congress in Egypt and the global AIESEC network, hosting 1200 participants, partners and ministries for 9 days. Delivered by a team of 90 members with a budget of $0.5 million.
‣ Built partnerships with the ministries of Youth and Tourism, and key partners including Vodafone and Microsoft.
‣ Participated in the definition of AIESEC’s strategy for the MENA region. Delivered keynotes at 6 international conferences for large audiences, including senior participants and ministers.
profile_positions.title: Country Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Results: 
‣ 780 exchange experiences delivered.
‣ 74% growth relative to previous year (2011/2012).
‣ Middle East and North Africa Regional Achievement Award.

Responsibilities:
‣ Led a national operations team of 3 members, and managed 6 local operations team leads; managing the sales, onboarding of 780 participants and preparations for the volunteering experiences. Realized 74% growth.
‣ Built relationships with 4 consulates to improve the visa issuing process, managed collaborations with other countries, and created the SOP for matching volunteers to accessible countries.
‣ Coached 8 local chapters' vice presidents in planning, product management and team management.
‣ International exchanges' data analysis and education to support local chapters' operations and product development.
‣ Developed 3-day conference agenda and managed workshops development and delivery.
‣ Designed and implemented a national incentive system to drive operational growth.
‣ Represented Middle East and North Africa region in a global summit for exchange development in Milan, Italy.
profile_positions.title: Product and Program Manager

volunteer_experiences.description:
Spreading awareness about current environmental issues facing India, and how we can change it by changing our habits and behaviours.
Ex: How carpooling can make a difference and how it can happen in cities such as Delhi.
